required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Amlodipine And Olmesartan Medoxomil In Hypertensive Filipino Patients
clinical_study.official_title: AN OPEN LABEL, NON-INTERVENTIONAL STUDY OF THE SAFETY, TOLERABILITY, AND EFFICACY OF AMLODIPINE AND OLMESARTAN MEDOXOMIL (NORMETECTM) IN FILIPINO PATIENTS WITH HYPERTENSION: A POST MARKETING SURVEILLANCE STUDY

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety, tolerability and efficacy of Amlodipine and Olmesartan medoxomil among Hypertensive Filipino patients.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The requirement for Post Marketing Surveillance was lifted by the Philippine FDA

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after last study drug administration (Week 12)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 28 days after last study drug administration (Week 12) that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pre-treatment state. AEs included both SAEs and non-SAEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in SBP and DBP at Week 12 With Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) and Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) at Weeks 4, 8 and 12 Without (w/o) LOCF
Percentage of Participants Achieving JNC VII Recommended Blood Pressure Goal at Week 12 With LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Based on JNC VII, the ultimate public health goal of antihypertensive therapy is to reduce cardiovascular and renal morbidity and mortality. The JNC VII recommended BP goal is <140/90 mmHg and <130/80 mmHg for participants with diabetes.

arm_group.description: Male and Female, 18 to 65 year old Filipino hypertensive patients prescribed by their doctors with Normetec

intervention.description: start dose is 5/20 mg, which can then be uptitrated to 5/40 mg up to 10/40 mg if BP goal is not reached during the 4 week follow-up

study_pop.textblock: Filipino Hypertensive patients ages 18-65 years old

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Filipino hypertensive subjects ages 18-65 years old whether naive or currently taking any other anti-hypertensive or those on monotherapy using CCBs or ARBs whom they want to shift on a fixed dose combination drug
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with contraindications to any of the component of the fixed drug (amlodipine or olmesartan medoxomil) or with malignant or secondary hypertension

facility.name: Metropolitan Medical Center Institutional Review Board
Armed Forces of the Philippines Medical Center

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The diagnostic criteria of hypertension (defined by Joint National Committee on Prevention, Detection, Evaluation, and Treatment of High Blood Pressure [JNC VII] as systolic blood pressure [BP] >=140 mmHg and diastolic BP >=90 mmHg) and the dosage of study medication were consistent with the investigator's routine clinical setting.

group.title: Normetec
group.description: Amlodipine/olmesartan medoxomil(Normetec) was prescribed and administered at the recommended starting dose of 5/20 milligrams (mg) once daily according to approved product information in the Philippines.

baseline.population: The full analysis set included all subjects who received at atleast 1 dose of amlodipine and olmesartan medoxomil.

group.title: Normetec

outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 28 days after last study drug administration (Week 12) that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pre-treatment state. AEs included both SAEs and non-SAEs.

outcome.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication during the observation period.

An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 28 days after last study drug administration (Week 12) that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pre-treatment state. outcome.title: Change From Baseline in SBP and DBP at Week 12 With Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
outcome.population: The full analysis population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication during the observation period; number analyzed=number of participants with observed value in category. LOCF method was used to impute missing values.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single enter publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This was an observational, non-interventional study which evaluated Filipino patients with hypertension at the outpatient clinic, and as such, study medication was prescribed at the discretion of the attending physician.
